aboutMe.description: I’m a passionate problem-solver who loves to design, code, and create meaningful digital experiences. With a background in network systems and web development, I’m always eager to learn and grow in new areas.

homePage.FindMeOn: Get in touch with me on

aboutMePage.aboutMeText: I am Imane Kimissi, a passionate future engineer in Network Systems and Programmable Services, expected to graduate in June 2025. I have strong experience in web development, network security, and cloud computing, along with a love for creative design and problem-solving. My work focuses on developing efficient, secure, and user-friendly solutions. I thrive on challenges that push my technical and creative boundaries. Beyond tech, I enjoy philosophy, music, and exploring the intersections between technology and creativity.
aboutMePage.motivationsText1: My primary motivation stems from a deep-seated desire to bridge the gap between technology and human-centered design. I believe that technology should serve as a tool to enhance people's lives, making their experiences more efficient and meaningful.
aboutMePage.motivationsText2: I am inspired by teams that foster creativity, encourage autonomy, and prioritize continuous learning. My ideal team is one that embraces diversity and nurtures mentorship, creating a culture of shared growth and innovation. I am excited to learn from my peers while also sharing my own knowledge and insights. Together, I believe we can push technological boundaries and create solutions that truly make a difference.
aboutMePage.bacTitle: Baccalauréat in Physical Sciences, French Option
bacDetails: Focused on mathematics, physics, and chemistry

aboutMePage.engineerDegreeTitle: Engineer’s Degree in Network Systems and Programmable Services, expected June 2025
aboutMePage.engineerDegreeCoursework: Coursework includes network architecture, cloud computing, and programming

projects.iotProject: Modeling and Detection of Connected Objects in a Smart Building

aboutMePage.internshipDescription: I developed a web app using React and Laravel to manage drilling machine data with a user-friendly interface for database updates and inspections. I also integrated it with an external system to auto-fill form fields with new data.
aboutMePage.seeMoreAboutTheProject: See more about the project in projects section

nav.ocpProject: Web Application for Drilling Machine Informations

portfolioWebsite.title: Portfolio Website
portfolioWebsite.description: This is my old portfolio website, hosted on GitHub, which serves as a personal showcase of my projects and skills. The site is designed to present my work in an aesthetically pleasing and user-friendly manner.

drillingMachine.title: Drilling Machine Management Application
drillingMachine.description: This application is designed to facilitate the management of drilling machines, allowing users to enter, inspect, and modify machine data with ease. The project is built using React for the front-end and Laravel for the back-end. It includes features for CRUD operations on drilling machine data and a responsive user interface. Additionally, I integrated the application with another external system, enabling it to send newly added data to automatically populate fields in the external system's forms.

blogWebsite.title: Blog Website
blogWebsite.description: This project is a blog website built with Flask and Bootstrap. It allows users to register, log in, and post or comment on blogs. Admins can manage the posts by creating, editing, and deleting them. The main features include user authentication and a commenting system. The code integrates Flask for backend management and Bootstrap for the front-end UI.

openVPN.title: OpenVPN Server on AWS
openVPN.description: In this project, we configured and deployed an OpenVPN server on AWS, leveraging the scalability and security features of the cloud. We used Amazon EC2 to host the VPN server, ensuring a flexible and reliable infrastructure. An Elastic IP from AWS was utilized to provide a static public address, allowing constant access to the VPN. Security Groups were configured to control incoming and outgoing traffic, ensuring that only the necessary ports (like 1194 for OpenVPN) were accessible. The cloud-based configuration allowed for scalability, monitoring, and easy management of the VPN infrastructure, providing secure remote access to our network.

pipeline.title: Azure DevOps Pipeline for ASP.NET Deployment on Azure
pipeline.description: As part of an academic group project, we set up a CI/CD pipeline using Azure DevOps to automate the build and deployment of an ASP.NET web application on Azure App Service. The process involved configuring the build pipeline to compile the application, run tests, and generate build artifacts. Subsequently, a deployment pipeline was established to automatically deploy the built application to Azure App Service, ensuring seamless updates with each commit to the repository. The cloud integration enabled scalability, continuous deployment, and streamlined management through Azure's infrastructure.
pipeline.tools: Azure (DevOps) - Azure (App Service) - ASP.NET - Git - Azure Repos

Fiveg.title: Virtualized 5G Network Deployment on Azure
Fiveg.description: This project focuses on deploying a virtualized 5G network on a cloud platform, using Microsoft Azure to host the key components of the network. The goal is to simulate a complete 5G architecture, where the core network functions (CN), including Access and Mobility Management Function (AMF), Session Management Function (SMF), and User Plane Function (UPF), are implemented using Open5GS. The Radio Access Network (RAN) is simulated with srsRAN. The entire architecture is hosted on Azure virtual machines, using Azure networking solutions like Azure Virtual Network (VNet) for internal communication between components. This setup allows for testing and demonstrating a 5G network in a cloud environment, highlighting the flexibility and scalability of cloud-based infrastructure.
Fiveg.tools: Azure - Open5GS - srsRAN - Docker - Azure Virtual Network (VNet) - Ubuntu VMs

nav.ids: Intrusion Detection System using ML and Zeek

network.FivegDescription: This project involves building a virtualized 5G network architecture by deploying core network (CN) and Radio Access Network (RAN) components in Azure cloud environment. The core network functions, such as mobility and session management, are implemented using Open5GS, while the RAN is simulated using srsRAN. These components are hosted on virtual machines (VMs), with cloud networking solutions facilitating their interaction. The primary focus is on demonstrating the flexibility, scalability, and efficiency of using cloud-based infrastructure to simulate a complete 5G network, allowing for easy deployment and management of network components.
network.toolsFiveg: Azure - Open5GS - srsRAN - Docker - Azure Virtual Network (VNet) - Ubuntu VMs
network.openVPNDescription: This project involved configuring and deploying an OpenVPN server on AWS to facilitate secure remote access to a network. The setup utilized various AWS services to ensure scalability, reliability, and security. By leveraging the cloud infrastructure, the project aimed to provide a robust VPN solution, allowing users to securely connect to resources over the internet while maintaining data confidentiality.
network.ids: Intrusion Detection System Using Machine Learning and Zeek
network.idsDescription: This academic group project focused on developing an Intrusion Detection System (IDS) utilizing machine learning techniques to enhance network security. The system was designed to analyze network traffic captured by Zeek, an open-source network security monitor, to identify anomalies and detect potential intrusions in real-time. An autoencoder was employed as the machine learning model due to its effectiveness in learning compressed representations of data, enabling the system to identify deviations from normal behavior efficiently. This approach aimed to improve the accuracy and efficiency of threat detection, providing organizations with a proactive method to safeguard their networks.
network.toolsIDS: Python - Scikit-learn - Pandas - NumPy - TensorFlow - Zeek - Autoencoders
network.FourgDescription: This project involves simulating a 4G cellular network using Atoll, a well-known radio planning and optimization software. The goal of the simulation is to evaluate the network’s performance, optimize coverage, and analyze key metrics such as signal strength, interference levels, and capacity.

yesOrNo.title: Yes or No Desktop Wheel App
yesOrNo.description: This project is a simple decision-making application built with Electron.js, allowing users to input customizable entries into a wheel. When spun, the app randomly selects either a 'Yes' or 'No' answer to help users with their decisions. The app features a user-friendly interface and customizable input options for flexibility.

desktopCleaner.title: Desktop Cleaner Automation Script
desktopCleaner.description: This Python script automatically organizes your desktop by sorting files into categorized folders based on their extensions, such as images, videos, executables, and more. Files starting with _imp are moved to a dedicated 'important' folder. If a file with the same name already exists in the destination folder, the script handles it by appending a unique identifier to avoid overwriting. It runs in the background, sending real-time notifications via Windows Toast when files are moved. Additionally, it is set to run at system startup through Task Scheduler, keeping your desktop tidy without manual intervention.

rockPaperScissors.title: Rock Paper Scissors Game
rockPaperScissors.description: JavaScript-Mini-Projects is a collection of basic projects aimed at helping beginners learn JavaScript and its associated technologies. I contributed to this repository by building the Rock Paper Scissors game and adding it to the project collection. It's a great project to demonstrate the use of JavaScript logic and DOM manipulation.

memoryGame.title: Memory Mobile Game
memoryGame.description: This is a Memory Game developed using Android Studio with Kotlin. The game involves a simple grid of blocks where a player is shown a pattern of highlighted blocks for a brief moment. The player is then required to memorize the pattern and reproduce it by tapping the correct blocks. As the game progresses, the complexity increases as the highlighted pattern becomes longer, challenging the player’s memory.

watermarkApp.title: Watermark Python Application
watermarkApp.description: Watermark Application is a simple Python application built with Tkinter to add watermarks to images. Users can drag and drop images into the application, browse for images and watermarks, customize the watermark position (top left, top right, bottom left, bottom right), adjust the watermark size, and download the watermarked images.

iotProject.title: Modeling and Detection of Connected Objects in a Smart Building
iotProject.description:
This project focuses on the modeling and detection of connected objects (such as sensors, cameras, thermostats) within a smart building using IoT-based simulations and scenarios. The goal is to design a system that models these devices' interactions, allowing for automatic and efficient detection, enhancing the building's management and energy efficiency. Key functionalities include modeling connected objects, automatic detection of IoT devices, IoT scenario creation, Python programming for data management, and performance analysis to improve energy consumption and security.
⁕ this project is still in progress.
iotProject.tools: Cisco Packet Tracer - Python - IoT - Scenario Creation

linuxServer.title: Implementation of a Linux Server Infrastructure for IT Room Management
linuxServer.description: This project focuses on the development of a robust infrastructure for managing an IT room, addressing key requirements such as automated IP address allocation, real-time machine monitoring, and centralized shared storage. The project leverages several critical technologies, including a DHCP server for dynamic IP assignment, a TrueNAS storage server for secure data management, and Zabbix for comprehensive monitoring of system health.
